result.execSummary:
The defendant Lianne R Soman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Ordinance Violation - Bail Jumping. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Any credit will be determined by counsel.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

Defendant may not consume/possess any alcohol.

Defendant may not enter into any bar/tavern.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

Must attend at least one AA/NA or similar type meeting once per week and provide proof of attendance to P&P.

All other conditions the same as count 1 with no additonal community service.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lianne R Soman

records.addlTxt: Defendant Lianne R Soman in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Lianne R Soman in custody.  Charles James Simono does not appear for the State of Wisconsin with leave of the Court due to an unforseen medical appt. Cour and Joy put on the record that it was a joint recommendation from the State and is willing to proceed without the State. Joy makes argument prior to his recommendation, credit for 271 days, recommends a time served sentence. Soman withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - 6 months in FC jail - credit for 6 months - time served, count #2 - 9 months in FC jail - credit for 9 months - time served, concurrent to each other, turn any unpaid fines into civil judgment, right to appeal, adjourned.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Lianne R Soman in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Lianne R Soman in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:32 PM. Called 16CF84 and 16CF128. State - here for AIA on both of these matters. Court has previously advised the defendant of the charges and penalties as has Joy. Joy waives time limits, requests PH. Court continues bond on both cases at this point, 16CF84 - $750.00 cash and on 16CF128 - $10,000 cash. Joy - bond - 16CF128 - asks for reduction in bond for stated reasons, $5000.00 cash. State - bond - 16CF128 - wants significant amount of cash but does not object to lowering the bond to $5,000.00 cash. Court - bond - 16CF128 - amend bond to $5,000.00 cash with same conditions, except add a condition of no consumption of alcohol. 15CF123 and 15CF81 - Joy - 15CF81 - plead NC to count #1 as alleged, withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years, #2 - amend to obstructing an officer contrary to 946.41, #3 - amend to county ordinance of bail jumping wioth a $500 fine plus costs, #4 - DRI; 15CF123 - plead to count #1 as alleged, 30 months probation with 90 days conditional jail time, restitution to be determined, #2 - DRI, #3 - plead as alleged with 30 months probation, #4 - DRI. State and Soman agree. State will recite probation conditions, 100 hours of community service on 15CF81 and 150 hours of community service on 15CF123 - have complied with victim notification requirements with no response received. Court - 15CF123 - court dismisses and reads in counts #2 and #4. Soman pleads G to count #1 and #3 as alleged. Court - 15CF81 - Soman pleads G to count #1 as alleged. Court - 15CF81 - amends count #2 to obstructing an officer contrary to 946.41 - reads new charge and penalty, Soman pleads G to amended count #2, Court dismisses and reads in count #4, Court amends count #3 to county ordinance of bail jumping, pleads G, finds G, fine of $500.00 fine plus costs and surcharges - 60 DTP/CO. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - additional conditions of probation would be AODA, no consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 100 hours of community service on 15CF81 and 150 hours of community service on 15CF123. Joy makes final argument prior to sentencting - follow joint recommendation - 116 days credit on 15CF81. Soman makes comment, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following:  15CF81 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, no consumption of possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, attend at least one AA/NA or similar type meeting once per week and provide proof of attendance to P&P, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 100 hours of community service, costs, credit to be determined by counsel (116 days credit but breakdown to be provided by counsel); 15CF123 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 30 months on each count - concurrent to each other -  with conditions of: count #1 only - 90 days in FC jail - huber allowed - eligible for community service under 973.09(7m) - credit to be determined by counsel, same conditions as 15CF81 except for an additional 150 hours of community service, costs, submit DNA sample with expunction rights given, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal. Court hears argument by Joy as to why the bond money in each case (15CF81 - $3,000.00, 15CF123 - $3500.00) should not be forfeited. State responds - no position. Court - bond - does not find good cause has been shown for failure to appear in Court - forfetits bond. Adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 6, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Jeffery Joy in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 11:53 AM. Called 15CF81, 15CF123 and 16CF84. State - has multiple cases. Joy not prepared to proceed today with PLEAS, have not had a chance to meet with Soman regarding new charges and would like to come to a global resolution on all cases. Court set for PLEAS in cases 15CF81 and 15CF123 and set 16CF84 for AIA. Court continues bond on all matters. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 16, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Jeffery Joy in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:55 PM. Called 15CF 81 & 15CF123. Joy not sure where the defendant is. Court will forfeit any bond posted, issues bench warrant body or $2,000 on each case.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 23, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Lianne R Soman not in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:30 AM. 16CF84 State - not here, S&C were mailed to last known address and not returned, requests forfeiture of any bond posted and a bench warrant. Court forfeits bond, issues bench warrant, body or $1000.00. Also called 15CF123 and 15CF81 - Court does not see that notices were sent for this matter so will not forfeit bond. Court wants both of these matters set for FPT/PLEAS . Court sets for PLEAS.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Notification of Warrant Detainers - Winnebago County

Attorney Jeffery Joy in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:49 PM. Also called 15CF81, 15CF123, 15TR545 and 15TR544. State - defendant not here. Joy - not sure where the defendant is, she was aware of today's date. Court - appears defendant was noticed for today's matter, Court finds defendant guilty by default on the two traffic matters, 60 DTP/SL on each case, forfeits any bond posted on other matters, cancels JT, impose costs of 1 day JT fees against the defendant of $1000.00, issues bench warrant, body or $2000.00 on each case.

Defendant Lianne R Soman in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:46 PM. Called 15CF123, 15TR545, 15TR544 and 15CF81. Joy - cannot come to an agreement and asks for trial date on all matters. 15CF123 - state is requesting a 2 day trial. 15CF81 - one day trial. State recites recommendation on the record. Soman understands what the recommendation is and agrees that offer will now be revoked. 15CF81 - 73 days credit, if revoked. Bond continued on both cases. Traffic citations to track.  Jury trial scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lianne R Soman in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Lianne R Soman in custody.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:35 PM. Also called 15CF123. Soman and Joy - waiving PH. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right to PH, finds probable cause on both cases, binds over for trial on each case. State has filed Informations that mirror the complaints. Joy has Informations, waives reading of both of them, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts plea, sets for FPT. Joy wants to address bond on 15CF123 - asking to reduce bond to $1000.00 cash. Stae - no objections. Court - bond - amend bond on 15CF123 to $1000 cash bond with same conditions.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
